ðŸ“– Summary: Arwes is a web framework written in TypeScript for building user interfaces with a futuristic sci-fi aesthetic, including designs, animations, and sound effects. It draws inspiration from Cyberprep and productions like Star Citizen and Halo, aiming to inspire advanced science and technology in web development.

ðŸ”¥ dockpeek | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Easy access and management of Docker container web interfaces across multiple hosts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ One-click web access â€¢ Automatic port mapping â€¢ Live container logs â€¢ Traefik integration â€¢ Multi-host management
ðŸ“– Summary: Dockpeek is a lightweight, self-hosted Docker dashboard that provides quick access to your containers' web interfaces. It simplifies container management by offering features like one-click access, automatic port mapping, live logs, Traefik integration, multi-host management, and image update checks.

ðŸ’¡ vulnhuntr | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated vulnerability detection in GitHub repositories.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Zero-shot vulnerability discovery using LLMs â€¢ Static code analysis â€¢ Detection of complex, multi-step vulnerabilities â€¢ Support for Python codebases â€¢ Identification of LFI, AFO, RCE, XSS, SQLI, SSRF, and IDOR vulnerabilities
ðŸ“– Summary: Vulnhuntr is a tool that uses LLMs and static code analysis to automatically discover remotely exploitable vulnerabilities in software. It analyzes code call chains from user input to server output, aiming to detect complex, multi-step security vulnerabilities that traditional static analysis tools may miss.
